intro: Rhexia rosea, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has a short, creeping rhizome that gives it its common name. Its leaves are alternate, palmately lobed, and often have a reddish or purplish tinge. Rhexia rosea is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native habitat.
